title: Genius Hyderabad Man Prints 'AP CM Jagan' On Car Number Plate To Evade Toll Tax & Police!
text:
Have you noticed that many vehicles have press, judge or MLA stickers on their cars, in the hope of being exempted from paying toll tax or parking charges? Well, this man from Hyderabad did something that has stunned the police and people alike.

This car owner has ‘AP CM Jagan’ written, not as a sticker, but on his number plate - front and rear. The incident came into light when a regular checking of vehicles was taking place on October 19 by the traffic police in Jedimetla, Hyderabad.

M Hari Rakesh told the police that he got this name plate on his number plate, just to avoid paying the toll tax and evade checking by the traffic police. The police have now seized Rakesh’s car and filed a case of cheating and fraud against him.

Telangana: Case registered against a person by Jeedimetla police for driving a car with 'AP CM JAGAN' written on it, in place of the vehicle's registration number. #Hyderabad pic.twitter.com/kSw40Szwsu — ANI (@ANI) October 22, 2019

Not so long ago, the government announced that it earned a revenue amount of Rs 25,000 crore by collecting toll on highways, in the last three years. With a total of 549 toll plazas across the country, the highways are a big source of earning for the government.

However, despite filling coffers of the government, the highways are neither in a good condition, nor are safe for people as they continue to be notorious for accidents, kidnappings, muggings and murders.

Well, let us hope the man learnt his lesson, and will not try another such smart-ass trick to evade toll tax and the police.
